Reviews.Title: Good Spartan Smartphone Without Contract
Reviews.Author: Mr. Staack
Reviews.Content: The Rumor2 on Virgin Mobile will NOT appeal to technophiles who want the latest and greatest, but this is a really good smartphone for those who have very modest needs but want a solid well-built phone with good battery life and a full keyboard.  The chicklet-style QWERTY keyboard is pretty good, making it easy to type by touch (instead of hunting and pecking).  The outer keypad ain't to shabby either.  The screen isn't very big, but reasonably sharp, with good color and contrast and pretty bright.  The call sound is pretty good, depending on the strength of your signal - but under ideal situations, I've had very clear conversations.  The Rumor2's speakerphone is reasonably loud, certainly enough for hands-free use in a car.  It synced up with all of my Bluetooth headsets without much difficulty.  I invested in a snap-on case that has helped it stand up to a few bumps, without any problems.  The screen slides effortlessly, and feels very sturdy.  Internet browsing is dependent on your signal, but only about as fast as 56k dial-up.  The default browser, Myriad V7, is pretty lousy.  However, you can install Opera Mini 4, which is light-years better. Through Opera's automatic compression feature, you can browse around a lot faster.  The camera is a 1.3MP through software trickery (probably image interpolation), but still fairly good for a phone camera with good light sensitivity, auto-focus, and good color depth.  The internal memory is a little small, but the Rumor2 accepts MicroSD cards (the largest I've tested was 2GB).  The contact manager is pretty good, allowing for a lot of info per contact and personalized photos.  All the other features like calendar, alarm, calculator, etc. are decent - they work, with few frills.  It's easy to change the wallpaper, if you have a MicroSD card - just save any JPEG to the card, and you can save it as a wallpaper, or assign it to any contact.  The music player is also pretty nice, though it'll never replace a dedicated media player.  The battery life is decent, given its medium size, compared to other more-powerful smartphones.  Nicer 3rd party compatible 950+ mAH batteries are available, to extend usage.  It recharges via the USB Micro port at the bottom, and can recharge from an AC or auto power supply (4.6V), or PC USB cable (2.5V).  I was surprised how many different colored cases and accessories there were, as well, so you can bling it out pretty good (if that's your thing).The few negatives are that you cannot customize your ringtone - you have to buy ringtones from Virgin Mobile.  The stock ringtones are just awful, so you'll probably have to sink $1 for a customized ringtone (using a basic composer) or $3 for a pre-made ringtone (VM at least has a good selection).  You cannot access the phone via USB or Bluetooth - it's entirely locked down, and I have been unable to unlock it with BitPim.  You can transfer files via the MicroSD card (photos & MP3s), or download from Opera, but the phone simply doesn't allow you to mess with ringtones or the contacts list.  Tethering is out, as well.  The Rumor2 can't play videos, even though it's probably capable of it (if you run the camera, it refreshes 15fps full screen).  They also limited what Java apps you can run, pretty much down to their stock email/im app, Opera Mini 4, Google Maps, and a few others.  Google Maps works well, but navigation is disabled - you have to pay-per-use or subscribe in order to get real-time GPS and turn-by-turn navigation.  I've used it once, when my dedicated GPS pooped out, and it worked well, but it's not as good as a dedicated GPS unit and it's a little pricy.For my modest needs, the good outweighs the bad by a large margin.  I needed a spartan smartphone that I can use to check Gmail, send text message, make the occasional phone call, occasionally check Facebook, occasionally check the map, and check the weather.  The handset was cheap, with a gift certificate, and it does everything I need it to do at acceptable speeds. With the $25/month Virgin Mobile service, I get 300 minutes (which I rarely ever get even halfway to) and unlimited text and data.  I don't need an iPhone or high-end Android phone...  This phone suits my need, and was very affordable - perfect for a cheapskate like me!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful simple phone
Reviews.Author: Autumn
Reviews.Content: I love this phone! It's really easy to use, and the slide-out keyboard is really great. I was looking for something simple and inexpensive, and this turned out to be just the thing. The default web browser isn't the greatest, but Opera Mini is fantastic (and it was already installed on the phone when I got it). The screen is nice and bright, and the backlit keyboard and keypad are both awesome. Unfortunately, Google Maps won't work, although I'm not entirely sure why. It's not something I'd use all the time anyway. Overall, great phone!

Reviews.Title: AWESOMENESS
Reviews.Author: romukusdejour
Reviews.Content: works great! a little difficult to type on the qwerty keyboard because of spacing but an awesome product none the less

Reviews.Title: Rumor2 prepaid cellphone
Reviews.Author: somach4art
Reviews.Content: Package arrived VERY quickly (in an envelope vs boxed) but actual hard plastic package inside held up. Odd that the battery was not cellophane wrapped like others in new boxes. Besides the phone, battery, charger, and headphone (not really ear-friendly), there were only 2 short sheets of info: Terms of Service and 'starter guide'. No product User Guide though I figured how to insert the battery anyway. Future customers may have to download the 100-page pdf file for cellphone How-To's, etc. from the HELP tabvirginmobileusa.com/resources/phones/prepaid/manual/lg-rumor2.pdfThat said, it's a great phone. Online research tags it high as the best for its price in prepaid phones and features plus this battery life is 6.5 hours (buy car charger separately for $20). Nice key touch, qwertpad, great pic resolution. I'm hoping this battery lasts... I'm really all for this phone, just giving heads up.

Reviews.Title: Lg Rumor 2 Virgin Mobile
Reviews.Author: e-Deal
Reviews.Content: This Lg Rumor 2 is a solid phone. It looks good and it's built with good materials. It's a reliable phone: speakers and microphone are good. The full keyboard is excellent. But if you like taking photos and using Internet you can have a bad surprise. Very slow in browsing and the VGA camera is another weak point.In summary if you need a very good phone with several functions (agenda, notepad, alarm, speaker, texts) at a very good price this is the deal for you. If you are looking for a smartphone and you like social network and staying connected with facebook and Internet, this is not a phone for you.

Reviews.Title: Hard to find a basic phone.
Reviews.Author: C.
Reviews.Content: The basic phones are no longer available through Virgin Mobile, for the plan I have with Virgin Mobile. And they can't be found in any of the 'big box stores'.This is one I've used for years. This is my 3rd LG rumor 2. They last a little over 2 years.Easy to use.Battery life is great.Slide out Qwerty keyboard.Camera is ok in a pinch.Brand new in box.

Reviews.Title: Good Cheap Phone
Reviews.Author: Chase A. Matthies
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone to cut down on my monthly cellphone bills.  Virgin Mobile is a great company if you only like to do phone calls and text.  I would definitely reccommend this phone for anyone if that is all they like to do on their phone.  The slide out keyboard works well if you have small hands and the battery life lasts for several days.

Reviews.Title: Great for calls and text messages for the price
Reviews.Author: ConnieP
Reviews.Content: I came across this phone while looking for something reasonably priced for my teenage daughter's first cell phone.  Not only was the phone inexpensive, but the Virgin Mobile plan was considerably cheaper than the phone service I had with Verizon.  The phone works great for talking and texting, which is what I wanted for my daughter.  (It does NOT work well for Internet access and picture taking.)  I was so impressed with her phone/service that I quit Verizon and bought a Rumor 2 phone (with Virgin Mobile service) for myself.  My daughter has since upgraded to a phone with better Internet access and picture taking, but I am content with the phone since it does what I need it to do at a good price.

Reviews.Title: LG RUMOR 2 VIRGIN MOBILE
Reviews.Author: PHYLLIS
Reviews.Content: Iliked this phone because of the weight . I could feel it in my hand. But the biggest problem with the service was that it would always drop calls. All the time & it was static. Which made it hard to hold o canversation with any one.

Reviews.Title: Not for me
Reviews.Author: ForeverWild
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone because I bought a car with Uconnect and it was on the approved list of phones compatible with the system. Unfortunately, whether it's the phone or the network, it does not work with Uconnect. It will disconnect a call within 27 sec. and constantly restart the phone. Unless you buy a micro SDHC card, forget a selection of ringtones, I think there are 3 on the phone, all which sound terrible. Even the tones (also 3) bite and I'm not picky. I think worst of all, the phone call quality is sketchy. It may be better in your area, but where I live (which is about an hour from L.A., so not rural) it's bad - the callers can barely hear me.Overall a waste of money. This is my first phone and plan with Virgin Mobile and I won't be renewing for a another month.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: This was purchased for a 16 year old that does not know how to take care of his phone.  I didn't want to spend a lot of money on a phone where it will only get destroyed quickly.  For the price, it is functional and has features that would not embarrass a 16 year old.

Reviews.Title: Phone Review
Reviews.Author: SimplisticSmiles
Reviews.Content: This phone has made me incredibly happy.  I can connect with my friends, while not having to worry about being too technologically minded.  It's fantastic! :)

Reviews.Title: Seller was great, Virgin Mobile not so!
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: The cell phone was an exact replacement for a phone stolen from me.  However, I was disappointed with Virgin Mobile for not helping the situation.  The thief changed my payment plan from the cell phone.  After I realized it was stolen, I reported it to Virgin Mobile.  After obtaining the new phone, Virgin Mobile would not change my plan back to what it was before the phone was stolen.  I'm now paying twice as much per minute.  I lost the ringtones that I paid for and lost $55 for the one day the thief used the old phone.  I can no longer recommend Virgin Mobile.

Reviews.Title: Adequate.
Reviews.Author: IT
Reviews.Content: An adequate phone from a barely adequate carrier.  I have used it for over a year and it has continued to be enough to get by without being great.I bought this phone as a step up from 10 cents a minute NET10.  Some features are as advertised, others are not.  The alleged data service is horrible.The top positives:1) The slide-out QWERTY keyboard is awesome.  Enough said!2) Bluetooth.  I have tried several devices.  All worked.3) The display has a very nice email/text message alert feature to show calls or messages you recently missed.  However, messages are limited.4) Pop in a micro-SD card for storage for photos.The top negatives:1) Basically, 3x as expensive as the next guy.  At $40/mo for 300 minutes, this phone fails to compare against the likes of T-mobile at $15/mo for 1500 minutes or $30/mo for 1500 minutes and 200 mb of data. Or, compare against NET10/TracPhone, at 10 cents per minute.2) Page loads on web surfing can take minutes, IF they complete at all.  I live in the Northwest suburbs of Chicago, so it's not a tower issue, it's bad service.  Many pages are just plain blocked.  For most purposes, the web is UNUSABLE.  Your account balance page loads reasonably fast, if that's all you want to surf.3) Voice quality is often terrible - an artifact of VM not LG.  I have tested from a landline to several phones/carriers in the family.  Virgin Mobile has been the worst. You might want to consider the other version of the Rumor and go with Verizon, instead.  Oh, and if you go with Virgin Mobile, keep your Bluetooth headset charged.  A weak Bluetooth on top of mediocre voice quality results in total garble. Almost funny when it's not completely sad.4) Want your contacts backed up? There's a fee for that.5) The low resolution camera is, well, low resolution.6) While the QWERTY part of the keyboard is standard, special characters are not.  Looking back at the history of LG keyboard layouts, this is yet another random layout for special characters!7) Don't expect any of the special codes that work on the Verizon phone to work on the Virgin Mobile model.

Reviews.Title: OMG love it
Reviews.Author: Zachary Fields
Reviews.Content: if i could give this item more stars i would. Came in brand new official VM package. The phone itself is amazing! ive had it for over 3 weeks now and the battery life is better than any phone ive had. Its lasted 5 days of constant texting and talking before it even went down one bar on battery. The phone itself is amazing though i would highly reccomend a case because it is a slippery feel on the phone. I suggest a body glove case. i have one and it makes it much easier to hold on to. the keyboard on both front and slide out are the best part. the slide out is just my size with the fingers i have to not make any mistakes when texing. call clarity is amazing. all in all, best phone ive ever had. highly suggest this phone and buying from this seller

Reviews.Title: biggest mistake of my life
Reviews.Author: Carrie
Reviews.Content: i dont know if the phone was locked or just stolen, but i couldn't activate it or use it for anything. waste of time and money. i will never make that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: works good
Reviews.Author: Holly12
Reviews.Content: This a durable phone. It works really good, all the gadgets work good. I would buy another LG Rumor 2 again.

Reviews.Title: It won't last
Reviews.Author: Grandpa "Grandpa"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone and after just about a year the talk time decreased to 5 minutes after a full charge.  I replaced the charger and purchased a new battery but the results are the same, even after a full charge I receive no more than 5 minutes of talk time.  When I explained this to Virgin Mobile their response was buy a new phone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!!! everything I had expected!
Reviews.Author: milner142790
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because I had one similar to it from Alltel called the LG Scoop and I loved it. I knew it would be a good phone for the price and it is!! I have not had a problem with it yet!

Reviews.Title: never again
Reviews.Author: yogi
Reviews.Content: you know the saying careful of what you wish for this phone,did that for me. i will not but another used phone again. not only was the phone locked it still had the owners picture on the screen saver.

Reviews.Title: WORST PHONE EVER MADE
Reviews.Author: paul preston
Reviews.Content: I bought mine at walmart to avoid shipping...that was 60 days ago and now when i go to turn the phone on,it comes on to the hello screen and just keeps blinking and SUPPOSEDLY it has a warranty but its not worth anything because when i call them to get them to do nothing more than send me a battery,they say they have to charge me for it or i can send it in to them so they can "inspect" it which they are also going to charge me for...if its buy a lg rumor 2 or something you homeade out of random computer chips and parts...take the homeade job at least it probably works,so dont buy this phone if you would like a good phone...cheap yes,good...miles from it
